intro: Pyrola alpina, commonly known as the alpine wintergreen, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the northern hemisphere. It typically reaches heights of 10–20 cm and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are dark green and leathery. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments such as boreal forests and alpine tundra. Pyrola alpina is known for its aromatic foliage and is often found in shaded, acidic soils.
